subject: Law
title: Federalism Explained
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Federalism Explained.

hook.text: Can a state legalize cannabis while federal law bans it? That tension is federalism in action.

buildup.text: Federalism divides power between a national government and state governments. Each has its own sphere.

discovery.text: The Tenth Amendment reserves all powers not given to the federal government to the states.

twist.text: But the Supremacy Clause says federal law wins when there's a direct conflict. The balance shifts constantly.

climax.text: Courts referee these disputes. Over time, federal power has grown far beyond the founders' original vision.

punchline.text: Federalism is a tug-of-war with no final winner.

quiz.question: What does the Supremacy Clause establish?
options: Federal law overrides conflicting state law
The president is above the law
